repnme.cdata!: Chad - Health and Safe Motherhood Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            while project sustainability is regarded as likely. Both the
            World Bank and Borrower prformances are assessed as
            satisfactory overall. Four lessons to be learned were
            gleaned from this project: First, a sound donor coordination
            framework is key to success. With their different strengths
            and program objectives, donors must fit into a national
            assistance strategy which is coordinated by Government, and
            donors must be willing to work together. Second, All
            potential stakeholders should be part of the discussion
            regarding planning for a hospital in their area. When
            specialized hospital units are established and equipped,
            sub-national/local capacities and needs (the epidemiological
            situation; population size; availability of qualified
            prsonnel such as technical, administrative, and management
            staff; and geographical and financial accessibility) should
            be considered along with relying on national standards.
            Third, field visits improve the accuracy of cost estimates,
            particularly where there has not been wide experience in the
            type of construction or civil works envisioned or areas have
            not been fully accessible. Fourth, benefits from outsourcing
            management tasks are potentially great, but success
            ultimately depends on the competence, experience, and
            reliability of the management agent. Further, the size of
            contractual responsibilities must be considered: the
            management agent should not be made responsible for areas
            beyond his competence.

repnme.cdata!: Chad - Health and Safe Motherhood Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Government of Chad has developed a
            National Health Plan (1993-2000) and launched the process of
            developing a population policy and its associated plan of
            action. The central objective of the health program is to
            increase access of the population to quality basic health
            care focusing particularly on the most vulnerable groups of
            the population - children and women of child bearing age.
            Within the above framework, the Health and Safe Motherhood
            Project will support the development and implementation of
            policies and investments designed to: 1) strengthen
            capability at the central level to support regional health
            services; 2) provide assistance for health, nutritional and
            family planning services to the regions of Guera and
            Tandjile by establishing a network of district health
            facilities and by implementing skills upgrading programs for
            health personnel; 3) support the development and
            implementation of a national drug policy by developing the
            planning and management capacity of the Division of Pharmacy
            and creating a Central Purchasing Agency for essential and
            generic drugs.
